awards:
第44届戛纳电影节(1991)
　　主竞赛单元 短片金棕榈奖(提名) 比尔·普莱姆顿
　　主竞赛单元 短片评审团奖 比尔·普莱姆顿

writer.name: 莫林 麦克艾赫隆 Maureen McElheron
比尔·普莱姆顿 Bill Plympton

director.name: 比尔·普莱姆顿 Bill Plympton

introduction: Push Comes to Shove is an animated short about two men looking the same doing various bizarre things to their faces. Like one pulling the other's ears forward, tying them in front of his face, getting a big rock in between the tied ears and pulling said ears with rock toward the face making a big fluffy hole on it. Or using grass seed with water on other's face, growing grass on it, and using a lawnmower to mow it down! Or painting red marks on it so it looks like a baseball before hitting it, then another face appears literally from the neck up! Like I said, pretty bizarre and highly recommend! I saw this on Volume 5 of The International Tournee of Animation from 1992. Well worth seeing if you like the offbeat.
